originalText.text:
Base part of my experience

I recently completed a course at New Age Training School, and my experience has been nothing short of disappointing. From the very beginning, it became evident that this institution was not what it claimed to be.

One of the most significant issues I faced was the lack of proper equipment and classroom preparation. In comparison to other schools in my class, the facilities at New Age Training School were severely lacking. Learning vital signs, a fundamental skill in my field, I feel i didn't learn it the right way

Although there were a few good teachers, the overall school system left much to be desired. What bothered me the most was the deception practiced by the school administration. They made false promises, . The admission process was particularly troubling, as the admission staff resorted to dishonest tactics to convince students to enroll.
Another concerning issue was the mandatory extra hours they required after completing all the classes what they call  . externship That I have to complete 250 These hours were essentially unpaid work, forcing me to sacrifice time from my job to fulfill this obligation now I have to cut hours which mean I‚Äôm going to make less money plus I have to pay for the students loan . This not only felt like a scam but also an unethical practice, leaving me deeply regretful of my decision to enroll in this school.

originalText.text:
I‚Äôm sad to write this review. I called about financial aid today and I was thanking the lady giving me information when discussing loan options for the MA program because I was told financial aid is no longer offered for that program. While thanking her, she abruptly hung up on me... I assume she took me thanking her as me cutting her off and no longer wanting to hear any further information, which wasn‚Äôt the case at all.

This is the first time I‚Äôve considered a school, contacted them and then was treated rudely over a reasonable question regarding financial aid and enrollment.

originalText.text: I just got a reference from my favorite teacher, Ms. Guyah. I had a lot of classes with her, including phlebotomy, which is coming in useful for the job I‚Äôm starting. I ultimately decided that being a medical assistant wasn‚Äôt for me and have decided to get into harm reduction instead, but the skills I learned from Ms. Guyah are what got me the job, as well as my personality and history. Taking her classes was always super fun and we laughed a lot while we learned with her support. Whatever she said in the reference for this job obviously helped me out a lot and I appreciate her and my time in her class so much! Even though I ultimately decided not to be a medical assistant, I‚Äôm able to bring the skills I learned into a different career. Thanks for everything, Ms. Guyah! You‚Äôre the best and I‚Äôll keep you updated on all of my future successes! You made a huge impression on me.

originalText.text: Ms. Zanko was my CNA teacher, she's an absolute gem and loves her students. She's always looking out for you and wants you to pass, I'd definitely recommend her. The school itself is amazing too, very resourceful and helps you out a lot. I can't wait to continue my education with New Age Training!
